Package core

Interface HlaSaveRestoreManager

  • public interface HlaSaveRestoreManager
    Manager used to manage saving and restoring the federate.

    Limitations in the current implementation:

    • Instances can not be saved. If the HlaWorld has any local or remote instances the save will fail.
    • Save and restore can only be performed within the same federation, it is not possible to save, resign, join a new federation and then restore.

    This class is ThreadSafe as defined by Java Concurrency in Practice, see jcip.net.

    • Method Detail

      • requestFederationSave

        void requestFederationSave​(java.lang.String label)
                    throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                           HlaRtiException,
                           HlaSaveInProgressException,
                           HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Request that the federation should save its state. The actual save should be performed in the performFederateSave method in the HlaSaveRestoreListener.
        Parameters:
        label - label used to identify a saved state
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • requestFederationSave

        void requestFederationSave​(java.lang.String label,
                           HlaLogicalTime saveTime)
                    throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                           HlaRtiException,
                           HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                           HlaSaveInProgressException,
                           HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Request that the federation should save its state at the supplied logical time. The actual save should be performed in the performFederateSave method in the HlaSaveRestoreListener.
        Parameters:
        label - label used to identify a saved state
        saveTime - logical time when the federation save should happen
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is invalid
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • requestFederationRestore

        boolean requestFederationRestore​(java.lang.String label)
                          throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                 HlaRtiException,
                                 HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                 HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Request that the federation should restore its state to a previously saved state. The actual restore should be performed in the performFederateRestore method in the HlaSaveRestoreListener.
        Parameters:
        label - label used to identify a saved state
        Returns:
        true if the request was successful
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • awaitGrantedStateAfterRestore

        boolean awaitGrantedStateAfterRestore​(long timeout,
                                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Causes the current thread to wait until the granted state has been achieved after the federation has been restored, unless the thread is interrupted, or the specified waiting time elapses. This method should only be called after the restore has been completed.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument
        Returns:
        true if the granted state has been achieved
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting

      • setHlaSaveRestoreListener

        void setHlaSaveRestoreListener​(HlaSaveRestoreListener listener)
        Sets the save and restore listener. The default listener is initially used. The default listener will reject save and restore requests by returning false from performFederateSave and performFederateRestore.
        Parameters:
        listener - listener to use, if null the default listener will be used

      • isSaveInProgress

        boolean isSaveInProgress()
        Check if save is currently in progress. Note that calls may throw the HlaSaveInProgressException even if this method return false since a save operation can be initiated by another federate at any time.
        Returns:
        true if save is currently in progress

      • isRestoreInProgress

        boolean isRestoreInProgress()
        Check if restore is currently in progress. Note that calls may throw the HlaRestoreInProgressException even if this method return false since a restore operation can be initiated by another federate at any time.
        Returns:
        true if restore is currently in progress
